episodeTitle: One Phenomenon After Another! Disembarking at Thriller Bark
description: The Straw Hats arrive at the mysterious Thriller Bark island. Brook departs by running across the ocean. Nami, Usopp, and Chopper explore the island using the newly revealed Mini Merry II and encounter strange phenomena including a three-headed Cerberus and a vampire-like creature named Hildon.

events.title: Arrival at Thriller Bark
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at the mysterious Thriller Bark island, which is shrouded in thick fog. Brook reveals that this is the island he has been waiting for, the one where his shadow was stolen.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Thriller Bark arc proper, where the crew will face Gecko Moria and his zombie army. The island's arrival is what Brook has been waiting for to reclaim his shadow.

quotes.text: This island... it drifted from West Blue.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook explains the origin of Thriller Bark island

events.title: Brook Departs to Reclaim His Shadow
events.description: Brook bids farewell to the Straw Hats and leaps overboard, running across the ocean's surface using his lightweight skeleton body. He heads toward Thriller Bark to confront whoever stole his shadow.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's unique skeletal ability to run on water and shows his determination to reclaim his shadow so he can reunite with Laboon. This separates Brook from the crew temporarily.

quotes.text: I must go now. I have to reclaim my shadow!
quotes.speaker: Brook

events.title: Mini Merry II Debut
events.description: Franky unveils the Mini Merry II from the Soldier Dock System Channel 2 of the Thousand Sunny. This small four-person paddle boat is designed as a tribute to the Going Merry, featuring a steam engine and paddle wheels.
events.significance: First appearance of the Mini Merry II, which Franky created to honor the crew's former ship. This vessel becomes important for exploration and escape throughout the series.

quotes.text: This is Channel 2 - the Mini Merry II! A present from me to you guys!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky reveals his creation to honor the Going Merry

events.title: Absalom's Invisible Attack
events.description: An invisible entity attacks the crew members remaining on the Thousand Sunny, manipulating objects and touching Robin inappropriately. This is the first appearance of Absalom using his Suke Suke no Mi powers, though his identity remains unknown to the crew.
events.significance: First demonstration of Absalom's Clear-Clear Fruit powers and introduction of one of the Mysterious Four. This event foreshadows the danger posed by Thriller Bark's inhabitants.

events.title: Encounter with Cerberus
events.description: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper encounter a three-headed dog zombie while exploring the island. However, one of its heads is actually a fox, which seems to anger the creature. The trio flees in terror from this strange zombie guardian.
events.significance: First encounter with one of Thriller Bark's zombie creatures, introducing the horror element of the arc and demonstrating the bizarre nature of Gecko Moria's zombie creations.

quotes.text: This must be Cerberus, the guard dog of hell!
quotes.speaker: Chopper

events.title: Hildon's Introduction
events.description: After fleeing from Cerberus, Nami, Usopp, and Chopper encounter Hildon, a bat-like vampire zombie. He politely introduces himself and offers to take them to Dr. Hogback's mansion in his carriage, claiming the doctor lives on the island.
events.significance: Introduction of Hildon, one of the Thriller Bark zombies, and the first mention of Dr. Hogback being on the island. This sets up the reunion with Hogback and reveals the arc's connection to Chopper's idol.

quotes.text: Please allow me to escort you to the mansion of the great Dr. Hogback!
quotes.speaker: Hildon
quotes.context: Hildon offers to guide the trio

events.title: Chopper's Excitement About Dr. Hogback
events.description: When Hildon mentions Dr. Hogback's name, Chopper becomes extremely excited and explains to Nami and Usopp that Hogback is a legendary genius surgeon who won many medical awards before mysteriously disappearing from the medical community. Chopper idolized him.
events.significance: Reveals Chopper's deep admiration for Dr. Hogback and sets up the emotional conflict that will occur when Chopper discovers Hogback's true nature and unethical practices with zombies.

quotes.text: Dr. Hogback is a genius! His operations were miraculous!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper explains why he admires Hogback

events.title: Thriller Bark's Origin Revealed
events.description: Brook explains that Thriller Bark is not a natural island but an island ship that drifted from the West Blue. It has been lurking in the Florian Triangle for years, and it's the world's largest ship.
events.significance: Provides important world-building information about Thriller Bark's nature as a mobile island ship and its connection to the West Blue, foreshadowing its connection to Gecko Moria's past.

quotes.text: This island... it drifted from West Blue.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Explaining the origin of Thriller Bark

quotes.text: This is Channel 2 - the Mini Merry II! A present from me to you guys!
quotes.speaker: Franky

quotes.text: This must be Cerberus, the guard dog of hell!
quotes.speaker: Chopper

quotes.text: Dr. Hogback is a genius! His operations were miraculous!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Explaining his admiration for Dr. Hogback

themes.description: The episode establishes the eerie atmosphere of Thriller Bark with fog, zombies, and unexplained phenomena that create tension and mystery.
themes.symbolism: The thick fog surrounding Thriller Bark represents the unknown dangers and secrets hidden within the island.

themes.description: Franky's creation of the Mini Merry II demonstrates his understanding of the crew's emotional attachment to the Going Merry and his desire to honor their lost ship.
themes.symbolism: The Mini Merry II symbolizes the crew's continuing connection to their past and the memory of their beloved first ship.

themes.description: Chopper's excitement about meeting his idol Dr. Hogback sets up the theme of hero worship and the potential for disappointment when meeting one's heroes.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's innocent admiration foreshadows the painful lesson he will learn about his idol's true nature.

characterSpotlights.development: Brook demonstrates his determination to reclaim his shadow and shows his unique ability to run on water due to his lightweight skeleton.
keyActions: Explains Thriller Bark's origin from West Blue
Departs from the crew to pursue his shadow
quotes: This island... it drifted from West Blue.
I must go now. I have to reclaim my shadow!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his sentimental side and understanding of the crew's emotions by creating the Mini Merry II as a tribute to their former ship.
keyActions: Unveils the Mini Merry II from Soldier Dock Channel 2
Explains the boat's features and purpose
Sends Nami, Usopp, and Chopper on its maiden voyage
quotes: This is Channel 2 - the Mini Merry II! A present from me to you guys!

characterSpotlights.development: Reveals his deep admiration for Dr. Hogback, setting up emotional stakes for the arc. His medical knowledge makes him respect Hogback's legendary reputation.
keyActions: Identifies Cerberus as a three-headed creature
Becomes excited upon hearing Dr. Hogback's name
quotes: This must be Cerberus, the guard dog of hell!
Dr. Hogback is a genius! His operations were miraculous!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scene of the invisible attack on the Thousand Sunny with more comedic reactions from the crew.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time the Mini Merry II is shown, which becomes a recurring vessel throughout the series for island exploration.

sources.title: Mini Merry II - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Cerberus zombie has one fox head among its three heads instead of being three identical dog heads, which is a unique twist on the mythological Cerberus.
Episode 339 adapts Chapter 444 of the manga, titled 'Adventure on Ghost Island'.
Absalom's Suke Suke no Mi (Clear-Clear Fruit) makes its first appearance in this episode, though Absalom himself is not visually revealed yet.
